question: Question_01_(g)
statement:
You are using the Newton-Raphson Method to approximate a solution of an
equation f(x) = x and you make an initial guess $x_0 = 3$ to the
solution. If the tangent line to y = f(x) at x = 3 has the equation y =
5x - 7, what is the next approximation $x_1$ to the solution?
hints:
Notice that finding a solution to f(x)=x is the same as finding the root
of an equation g(x)=f(x)-x.

How can you use the tangent line y=5x-7 to give you information about
$\displaystyle {}f(x_0)$ and $\displaystyle {}f'(x_0)$?
